author: Lantana Nasir
title: Campus Journalism Awards: DG VON To Lead Assembly Of Dignitaries
text:
The Director-General of Voice of Nigeria, Jibrin Ndace, will preside over a distinguished assembly of dignitaries at the Sixth Annual Campus Journalism Awards.
This prestigious event is scheduled to take place on Saturday, December 7, 2024, at the Cosmopolitan University Hall in Abuja.
The event, themed “Thriving in the 21st Century Media Landscape,” will celebrate outstanding campus journalists across Nigerian universities.
Ndace will serve as the Special Guest of Honour, while Azubuike Ishiekwene, Senior Vice Chairman and Editor-in-Chief of LEADERSHIP Newspapers, will deliver the keynote address.
Other notable dignitaries expected to attend include Comrade Auwal Ibrahim Musa Rafsanjani, Executive Director of the Civil Society Legislative Advocacy Centre (CISLAC); Mohammed Abu Ibrahim, Executive Secretary of the National Agricultural Development Fund; Mohammed Idris, Minister of Information and National Orientation; and Lanre Issa-Onilu, Director General of the National Orientation Agency (NOA).
This year’s edition of the Campus Journalism Awards attracted 373 entries across 12 categories, with 36 finalists shortlisted.
Chief Superintendent of Customs Abdullahi Aliyu Maiwada and keynote speaker Azubuike Ishiekwene will also be honoured with the prestigious Honorary Patron Awards.
The event promises to be an exciting celebration of campus journalism in Nigeria.

author: Channing Frampton
title: LIVE UPDATES: Radar-confirmed tornado damages parts of Gadsden, Leon Counties
text: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (WTXL) — Storms containing radar-confirmed tornadoes, strong winds, dangerous lighting and heavy rain left a trail of damage in the Big Bend and South Georgia Friday morning. We're updating this story as damage reports come in. Watch the video above to see what it was like as the storm hit Tallahassee's All Saints neighborhood around 7 a.m. 10:40 A.M. According to a news release, Florida A&M University’s (FAMU) Tallahassee campus, FAMU Developmental Research School (DRS), and the Educational Research Center for Child Development, are closed Friday due to severe weather conditions, including a localized tornado warning. All non-essential employees are instructed to work from home. Those employees who have already reached campus are asked seek safe shelter immediately and to exercise caution as they return home. There are reports of power outages, downed trees, blocked roadways, and scattered debris across the campus. A damage assessment is being conducted. 10:35 A.M. On Twitter, Douglas Soule posted video of what remains of the Florida State University circus. A tornado-warned storm passed through the area Friday morning leaving behind a trail of destruction. The Tallahassee morning storm wreaked havoc on the Florida State University "Flying High" Circus tent. It’s no longer standing.— Douglas Soule (@DouglasSoule) [pic.twitter.com/r7VN8v8SdH] [May 10, 2024] 10:25 A.M. CityofTLH: Following today's intense weather and with more on its way, early assessments of the electric grid show severe damage to transmission lines, impacting 11 substations. Mutual aid has been requested, and crews from 8 utilities are on their way. Over 68,000 customers are without service. 10 A.M. Storms have knocked out power to neighborhoods across the Big Bend and South Georgia. This map from the First to Know Weather Center shows the extent of the outages. 9:45 A.M. Storms have cut power to traffic lights across the Tallahassee. If you come to an intersection without lights, treat it was a four-way stop. 9:20 A.M. Neighborhood reporter, Ashley Engle, is in the Railroad Square Arts District. Multiple buildings in this Tallahassee landmark sustained heavy damage from a storm Friday morning. Watch her Instagram reel below. 9:15 A.M. Leon County School District will close schools for the remainder of the day Friday. Parents: Please proceed to your school to pick up your students. After discussion with our school principals and staff, we have made the decision to close schools for the remainder of the day. Parents: Please proceed to your school to pick up tour students.— Leon County Schools (@LeonSchools) [pic.twitter.com/6Ab5k06QR5] [May 10, 2024] 9:00 A.M. Florida A&M University Tallahassee Campus and Tallahassee Community College will be closed on Friday. FAMU Developmental Research School (DRS), and the Educational Research Center for Child Development will also be closed. 8:15 A.M. An ABC 27 employee said his neighborhood got hit hard off Lipona and Jackson Bluff in Tallahassee. One neighbor's car got thrown around by the wind. 8:05 A.M. Neighborhood reporter, Maya Sargent, is in the Northwest Tallahassee neighborhood. She reports on the tree damage neighbors have seen. Watch video below. 8:00 A.M. A portion of the Visit Tallahassee Visitor Center has been damaged in the All Saints Neighborhood. This is across from Domi Station. 7:45 A.M. A crane appears to have collapsed on top of a construction project in the College Town area of Tallahassee. 7:05 A.M. Lauren Bueker took these photos of tree damage near Tharpe Street in Northwest Tallahassee.

author: Notimerica
title: Aeropuerto de Charleroi cancela todos los vuelos del viernes por extensión de huelga de trabajadores de tierra
text: BRUSELAS, 13 Sep. (EUROPA PRESS) - El aeropuerto de Charleroi, en el sur de Bélgica, ha anunciado la cancelación de todos los vuelos programados para este viernes debido a la extensión de la huelga de trabajadores de tierra que tiene paralizado por segunda jornada seguida el aeropuerto. En un comunicado, el gestor del aeropuerto de Charleroi señala que debido a la huelga sindical conjunta de este viernes todos los vuelos quedan anulados y pide a los pasajeros que no acudan a las instalaciones del aeródromo. "Lamentamos el impacto de estas acciones y pedimos disculpas por las molestias causadas", subraya. La acción sindical comenzó este jueves afectando a la totalidad de las operaciones aéreas previstas, con unos 200 vuelos cancelados y 30.000 pasajeros que se quedaron en tierra. La huelga que afecta a la gestión de equipajes, la facturación o repostaje de aviones se mantiene este viernes después de que no llegaran a buen puerto las negociaciones entre sindicatos y dirección del aeropuerto, que contaban con la participación de la ministra valona encargada de Aeropuertos, Cécile Neven. Desde la autoridad aeroportuaria critican que la huelga es "salvaje" y no respeta el preaviso presentado por los sindicatos el pasado 4 de septiembre y que da 15 días de margen para realizar los paros. Por su lado, los sindicatos han tildado de "histórico" el seguimiento de la huelga e insisten en denunciar el hacinamiento y la presión sobre las condiciones de trabajo.

author: Reuters
title: Suffering worst drought in decades, Costa Rica orders electricity rationing | Science-Environment
text: Suffering worst drought in decades, Costa Rica orders electricity rationing Struck by the worst drought in five decades, Costa Rica announced an electricity rationing plan on Thursday, blaming a severe lack of rainfall that has hobbled hydroelectric plants. The Central American nation famed for its beaches and lush landscapes that power ecotourism normally gets about 70% of its electricity supply from the plants. [Reuters](https://www.devdiscourse.com/reuters-stories)| Updated: 10-05-2024 02:16 IST | Created: 10-05-2024 02:16 IST Struck by the worst drought in five decades, Costa Rica announced an electricity rationing plan on Thursday, blaming a severe lack of rainfall that has hobbled hydroelectric plants. The Central American nation famed for its beaches and lush landscapes that power ecotourism normally gets about 70% of its electricity supply from the plants. State-run electricity company ICE has blamed the drought conditions partly on the weather phenomenon known as El Nino. Roberto Quiros, ICE's electricity director, described water levels at main reservoirs as "critical," adding the current El Nino is the most severe on record. He also pointed to delays in contracted deliveries from private power plants. The country last saw electricity rationing in 2007. The power cuts, to be implemented next Monday, are scheduled to last up to three hours daily but will not affect hospitals, industry or other high-voltage customers. ICE is also asking residential users to reduce consumption as much as possible. President Rodrigo Chaves has said he prays every day for rain as his requests to purchase energy from Costa Rica's neighbors have proved difficult since power shortages have also hit the broader region. Widespread power cuts blamed on a heat wave also hit Mexico earlier this week, in addition to similar problems in Colombia and Ecuador. The lack of rains has accompanied unusually unpredictable wind patterns, ICE officials noted, which has hit supplies from wind farms. This week, the company announced an alert signaling the possibility of rationing along with a so far unrealized forecast for imminent rainfall. Costa Rica's rainy season usually kicks off at the end of April. An uptick in demand has further complicated ICE's ability to meet it. Official data for January showed a 9% rise in electricity consumption compared to the same month last year. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) author: Lilian Moy
title: Rhône : à Vénissieux, une mosquée dans un bâtiment municipal agace la droite : Actualités - Orange
text: © ANDBZ/ABACA - Quartier des Minguettes à Vénissieux Plusieurs élus LR de la municipalité de Vénissieux (Rhône) ont déposé un signalement concernant la présence d’une mosquée au sein d’un foyer municipal. La préfecture va étudier le dossier, rapporte Le Figaro. À Vénissieux (Rhône), dans le quartier des Minguettes, dans la banlieue sud de Lyon, le foyer Debussy est utilisé depuis plusieurs années comme un lieu de culte. Une affiche précise même "Mosquée Es-Salam" en lettres blanches sur fond vert à l’entrée. Mais cela ne plaît guère aux élus des Républicains, rapporte Le Figaro vendredi 23 février. Cette situation a été dénoncée par le groupe d’opposition au conseil municipal "Vénissieux en mieux", composé de deux élus Les Républicains. Un autre membre du groupe, employé sur le secteur par le parti, a déposé un signalement auprès du procureur de la République de Lyon et de la préfète du Rhône, mercredi 21 février. "La mairie de Vénissieux met à disposition de la Mosquée Es-Salam la salle Claude Debussy pour des activités cultuelles, en contradiction flagrante avec les dispositions légales en vigueur car cette mise à disposition est continue et pérenne", explique notamment Quentin Taïeb. Selon lui, c’est "une situation préoccupante qui porte atteinte au principe de laïcité et à l'ordre public". Pour la maire de la ville, cette présence est légale En réponse, la maire de la commune, Michèle Picard (PCF), a affirmé que cette situation était bien légale. "Deux associations sur la dizaine qui utilisent les lieux ont des activités cultuelles mais il s'agit d'associations de type loi 1901, avec une convention d'occupation, comme un club sportif. Ces associations payent les charges, en toute légalité", a-t-elle réagi auprès du Figaro. "Cette décision ne doit pas revêtir un caractère exclusif et pérenne comme précisée par le Conseil d'État", a insisté Quentin Taïeb. La préfecture a reçu le signalement et va l’étudier. Le conseiller municipal demande ainsi de "libérer la salle Claude Debussy de son utilisation exclusive par la Mosquée Es-Salam" et pointe "la propension de Michèle Picard à pratiquer le communautarisme". publié le 23 février à 18h57, Lilian Moy, 6Medias

author: @httweets
title: Leo Daily Horoscope Today, January 24, 2025 predicts good health and well-being
text:
Leo Daily Horoscope Today, January 24, 2025 predicts good health and well-being
Leo Daily Horoscope Today, January 24, 2025 to know your astrological predictions. This day is filled with potential for you.
Leo – (23rd July to 22nd August)
Daily Horoscope Prediction says, shine Brightly with Leo's Daily Insights
Today offers opportunities for personal growth and connection. Focus on maintaining balance in relationships, career ambitions, financial planning, and well-being.
This day is filled with potential for Leos. Take a moment to assess your goals and prioritize your relationships. You may find success at work and strengthen your financial stability with careful planning. Stay aware of your health, and make time for self-care to keep your energy levels high. With balanced efforts, today can be fulfilling and rewarding.
Leo Love Horoscope Today:
Your love life may take center stage today. Whether single or in a relationship, it’s a good time to focus on emotional connections. For singles, a friendly gathering might introduce someone intriguing. Couples should spend quality time together to strengthen their bond. Open and honest communication will enhance mutual understanding, helping you and your partner navigate any minor conflicts.
Leo Career Horoscope Today:
Today is promising for your professional endeavors. You might find yourself presented with new opportunities or responsibilities that can enhance your skills. Be open to learning and collaborating with colleagues to achieve shared goals. Your leadership qualities are likely to shine, so don't hesitate to voice your ideas. Stay organized to manage your workload effectively, and take initiative where you see fit.
Leo Money Horoscope Today:
Financial considerations come to the forefront today. It's an ideal time to reassess your budget and make any necessary adjustments. Consider seeking advice on investments or savings strategies that can enhance your financial security. Avoid impulsive purchases, and focus on long-term goals. Keeping a watchful eye on your expenses will help maintain a healthy financial balance. With careful planning, you can make strides toward your monetary objectives.
Leo Health Horoscope Today:
Your well-being deserves attention today. Prioritize a balanced diet and regular exercise to keep your energy levels up. Consider integrating relaxation techniques like meditation or yoga into your routine to manage stress effectively. Pay attention to any minor health signals and address them promptly to avoid future complications. Remember, taking time for yourself is vital to maintaining both physical and mental health.
Leo Sign Attributes
- Strength: Generous, Loyal, Energetic, Enthusiastic
- Weakness: Arrogant, Luxury seeker, Careless, and Self-complacent
- Symbol: Lion
- Element: Fire
- Body Part: Heart & Spine
- Sign Ruler: Sun
- Lucky Day: Sunday
- Lucky Color: Golden
- Lucky Number: 19
- Lucky Stone: Ruby
Leo Sign Compatibility Chart
- Natural affinity: Aries, Gemini, Libra, Sagittarius
- Good compatibility: Leo, Aquarius
- Fair compatibility: Cancer, Virgo, Capricorn, Pisces
- Less compatibility: Taurus, Scorpio

author: Ryan Bonham
title: Bethel School District forming school board advisory committee for educational equity
text:
EUGENE, Ore. – Bethel School District officials want to ensure every student feels seen, supported, and included and, to get there, is forming a school board advisory committee on educational equity.
The committee will include parents and guardians, students, staff members, and people in the community which will, collectively, advise on policies that impact underserved student groups, share insights on equity challenges and successes, and help shape strategies for an inclusive future.
The district’s assistant superintendent, Remie Calalang, said that encouraging engagement is a key component in the committee’s success.
“By formalizing this committee,” Calalang said, “and identifying and clearly making it an advisory committee to the school board and also the superintendent, helps us ensure that those voices stay engaged in our process and it becomes a group that we can than turn to if we have wonderings or questions.”
Members will have to commit to quarterly meetings and those who are interested in applying may do so by visiting the Bethel School District’s
website. For more information, or call Calalang at 541-689-3280.

author: TOI World Desk
title: US Coast Guard: Watch: Captain clings to cooler for 8 hours in sea before getting rescued during Hurricane Milton - Times of India
text: As Hurricane Milton struck Florida, a fishing boat captain was stranded for 8 hours in the Gulf of Mexico. The captain faced extreme conditions in the sea before finally being rescued by the US Coast Guard.— ABC (@ABC) The captain, whose name was not released, went out early at around 3 am on Wednesday to repair his broken boat ‘Captain Dave,’ as reported by the Washington Post.Around noon, the boat’s owner reported to the Coast Guard that the captain hadn’t checked in. “Watchstanders were able to make radio contact with the captain who reported the rudder was fouled with a line and became disabled during his transit back to port,” the US Coast Guard agency said in the release.The fishing vessel earlier in the week had broken down some 20 miles off John’s Pass in Pinellas County, and the captain and another crew member were rescued from it on Monday, but the vessel was left with salvage arrangements to be made.At that time, the Coast Guard reported winds of around 30 mph and waves reaching 6-8 feet. As conditions worsened with Hurricane Milton approaching, Coast Guard officials instructed the captain to wear a life jacket and keep the boat's emergency beacon close to ensure he could be located.However, by 6:45 pm, roughly two hours before Milton made landfall 20 miles south of John’s Pass, the Coast Guard lost contact with him. The Coast Guard launched a tedious search and rescue operation at around 5:30 am on Thursday, deploying airplane and helicopter crews.After a harrowing night of survival, the captain was found clinging to a cooler 30 miles off Longboat Key, around 1:30 pm on Thursday, more than 8 hours later after contact was lost.“This man survived in a nightmare scenario for even the most experienced mariner,” Lt. Cmdr. Dana Grady, the Coast Guard’s command center chief in St. Petersburg, Fla., said in a news release.The unnamed captain survived the extreme conditions in an incredibly dangerous situation. “He experienced the severity of the hurricane conditions, we estimate he experienced approximately 75-90 mph winds, 20-25 foot waves, for an extended period of time to include overnight,” Grady said in the release.“He survived because of a life jacket, his emergency position indicating locator beacon, and a cooler,” Grady said.
